member.name: T:FastReport.BandBase
member.summary: Base class for all bands.

member.name: E:FastReport.BandBase.BeforeLayout
member.summary: This event occurs before the band layouts its child objects.

member.name: E:FastReport.BandBase.AfterLayout
member.summary: This event occurs after the child objects layout was finished.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.StartNewPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band should be printed from a new page.
member.remarks: New page is not generated when printing very first group or data row. This is made to avoid empty first page.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.RepeatBandNTimes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the number of repetitions of the same band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.FirstRowStartsNewPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the first row can start a new report page.
member.remarks: Use this property if is set to true. Normally the new page is not started when printing the first data row, to avoid empty first page.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.PrintOnBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band should be printed on the page bottom.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.KeepChild
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band should be printed together with its child band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.OutlineExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets an outline expression.

remarks.para: Outline is a tree control displayed in the preview window. It represents the prepared report structure. Each outline node can be clicked to navigate to the item in the prepared report.

To create the outline, set this property to any valid expression that represents the outline node text. This expression will be calculated when band is about to print, and its value will be added to the outline. Thus, nodes' hierarchy in the outline is similar to the bands' hierarchy in a report. That means there will be the main and subordinate outline nodes, corresponding to the main and subordinate bands in a report (a report with two levels of data or with groups can exemplify the point).

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Child
member.summary: Gets or sets a child band that will be printed right after this band.
member.remarks: Typical use of child band is to print several objects that can grow or shrink. It also can be done using the shift feature (via property), but in some cases it's not possible.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Objects
member.summary: Gets a collection of report objects belongs to this band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Repeated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that band is reprinted on a new page.
member.remarks: This property is applicable to the DataHeaderBand and GroupHeaderBand only. It returns true if its RepeatOnAllPages property is true and band is reprinted on a new page.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.BeforeLayoutEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script event name that will be fired before the band layouts its child objects.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.AfterLayoutEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script event name that will be fired after the child objects layout was finished.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Guides
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of guide lines for this band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.RowNo
member.summary: Gets a row number (the same value returned by the "Row#" system variable).
member.remarks:
This property can be used when running a report. It may be useful to print hierarchical row numbers in a master-detail report, like this:
1.1
1.2
2.1
2.2
To do this, put the Text object on a detail data band with the following text in it:
[Data1.RowNo].[Data2.RowNo]

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.AbsRowNo
member.summary: Gets an absolute row number (the same value returned by the "AbsRow#" system variable).

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.IsFirstRow
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that this is the first data row.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.IsLastRow
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that this is the last data row.

member.name: M:FastReport.BandBase.OnBeforeLayout(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method fires the BeforeLayout event and the script code connected to the BeforeLayoutEvent.

member.name: M:FastReport.BandBase.OnAfterLayout(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method fires the AfterLayout event and the script code connected to the AfterLayoutEvent.

member.name: M:FastReport.BandBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: T:FastReport.Base
member.summary: Represents the root class of the FastReport object's hierarhy.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.ExtractDefaultMacrosInternal(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.String)
member.summary: Does nothing

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object.

remarks.para: Name of the report object must contain alpha, digit, underscore symbols only. Data objects such as Variable, TableDataSource etc. can have any characters in they names. Each component must have unique name.

member.example:
The following code demonstrates how to find an object by its name:
TextObject text1 = report1.FindObject("Text1") as TextObject;
member.exception: Another object with such name exists.
Rename an object that was introduced in the ancestor report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Restrictions
member.summary: Gets or sets the flags that restrict some actions in the designer.
member.remarks: Use this property to restrict some user actions like move, resize, edit, delete. For example, if Restriction.DontMove flag is set, user cannot move the object in the designer.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Flags
member.summary: Gets the flags that allow some functionality in the designer.
member.remarks: Use this property only if you developing a new FastReport object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the object.

remarks.para: Each report object must have a parent in order to appear in the report. Parent must be able to contain objects of such type.

member.exception: Parent object cannot contain this object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.BaseName
member.summary: The base part of the object's name.
member.remarks: This property is used to automatically create unique object's name. See

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.ClassName
member.summary: Gets the short type name.
member.remarks: Returns the short type name, such as "TextObject".

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Report
member.summary: Gets reference to the parent object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Page
member.summary: Gets reference to the parent object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.ChildObjects
member.summary: Gets the collection of this object's child objects.
member.remarks: This property returns child objects that belongs to this object. For example, Report.ChildObjects will return only pages that contains in the report, but not page childs such as bands. To return all child objects, use property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.AllObjects
member.summary: Gets the collection of all child objects.
member.remarks: This property returns child objects that belongs to this object and to child objects of this object. For example, Report.AllObjects will return all objects that contains in the report - such as pages, bands, text objects.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z-order of the object.
member.remarks: The Z-order is also called "creation order". It is the index of an object in the parent's objects list. For example, put two text objects on a band. First object will have ZOrder = 0, second = 1. Setting the second object's ZOrder to 0 will move it to the back of the first text object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsAncestor
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object was introduced in the ancestor report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsDesigning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is in the design state.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsPrinting
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is currently printing.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is currently processed by the report engine.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.OriginalComponent
member.summary: Gets an original component for this object.
member.remarks: This property is used in the preview mode. Each object in the prepared report is bound to its original (from the report template). This technique is used to minimize the prepared report's size.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetProp(FastReport.Base,FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Helper method, helps to set a reference-type value to the property.
member.remarks: This method is used widely to set a new value to the property that references another FastReport object. Method deals with the property.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.FloatDiff(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks if two float values are different.
member.returns: true if values are not equal.
member.remarks: This method is needed to compare two float values using some precision (0.001). It is useful to compare objects' locations and sizes for equality.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.DeserializeSubItems(FastReport.Utils.FRReader)
member.summary: Deserializes nested object properties.

remarks.para: Typically the object serializes all properties to the single xml item:
Some objects like have child objects that serialized in subitems:
remarks.code: <DataBand Name="Data1" Top="163" Width="718.2" Height="18.9"> <TextObject Name="Text3" Left="18.9" Top="37.8" Width="283.5" Height="28.35"/> </DataBand>
remarks.para: To read such subitems, the DeserializeSubItems method is used. Base implementation reads the child objects. You may override it to read some specific subitems.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.ExtractDefaultMacros(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the macros in the given string and returns the new string.
member.returns: The text with macros replaced with its values.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetFlags(FastReport.Flags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set object's flags.
member.param: true to set the flag, false to reset.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetReport(FastReport.Report)
member.summary: Sets the reference to a Report.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetName(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the object's name.
member.remarks: This method is for internal use only. It just sets a new name without any checks (unlike the property setter).

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetParent(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Sets the object's parent.
member.remarks: This method is for internal use only. You can use it if you are developing a new component for FastReport. Override it to perform some actions when the parent of an object is changing. This method checks that parent can contain a child.
member.exception: Parent object cannot contain this object.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetParentCore(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Sets the object's parent.
member.remarks: This method is for internal use only. You can use it if you are developing a new component for FastReport. This method does not perform any checks, it just sets the new parent.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.FindObject(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for an object with given name.
member.param: Name of the object to find.
member.returns: Returns a null reference if object is not found

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.CreateUniqueName
member.summary: Creates the unique object's name.

remarks.para: Note: you have to set object's parent before calling this method. Method uses the property to create a name.
Note: this method may be very slow on a report that contains lots of objects. Consider using own naming logic in this case.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Clear
member.summary: Clears the object's state.
member.remarks: This method also disposes all object's children.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Serialize(FastReport.Utils.FRWriter)
member.summary: Serializes the object.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You should override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
This method is called when the object needs to save the state. It may happen when:

item.description: saving the report to the file or stream;
saving the report to the designer's undo buffer;
assigning the object to another object using the or AssignAll methods;
saving the object to the designer's clipboard;
saving the object to the preview (when run a report).

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Deserialize(FastReport.Utils.FRReader)
member.summary: Deserializes the object.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You should override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
This method is called when the object needs to restore the state. It may happen when:

item.description: loading the report from a file or stream;
loading the report from the designer's undo buffer;
assigning another object to this object using the or AssignAll methods;
loading the object from the designer's clipboard;

list.item: loading the object from the preview pages.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.BaseAssign(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Assigns values from another source.
member.remarks: Note: this method is relatively slow because it serializes an object to the xml and then deserializes it.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Assign(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Copies the contents of another, similar object.

remarks.para: Call Assign to copy the properties from another object of the same type. The standard form of a call to Assign is
which tells the destination object to copy the contents of the source object to itself. In this method, all child objects are ignored. If you want to copy child objects, use the AssignAll method.

member.param: Source object to copy the contents from.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.AssignAll(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Copies the contents (including children) of another, similar object.

remarks.para: This method is similar to method. It copies child objects as well.

member.param: Source object to copy the state from.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.HasParent(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has the specified parent in its parent hierarhy.
member.returns: Returns true if the object has given parent in its parent hierarhy.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.HasFlag(FastReport.Flags)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has a specified flag in its property.
member.returns: true if Flags property contains specified flag.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.HasRestriction(FastReport.Restrictions)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has a specified restriction in its property.
member.returns: true if Restrictions property contains specified restriction.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.InvokeEvent(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes script event.
member.param: Name of the event to invoke.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You should use it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
Use this method to call an event handler that is located in the report's script.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.OnAfterLoad
member.summary: Called after all report objects were loaded.
member.remarks: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.GetExpressions
member.summary: Gets all expressions contained in the object.
member.returns: Array of expressions or null if object contains no expressions.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.

This method is called by FastReport each time before run a report. FastReport do this to collect all expressions and compile them. For example, GetExpressions method of the class parses the text and returns all expressions found in the text.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.GetCustomScript
member.summary: Returns a custom code that will be added to the report script before report is run.
member.returns: A custom script text, if any. Otherwise returns null.

remarks.para: This method may return any valid code that may be inserted into the report script. Currently it is used in the TableObject to define the following script methods: Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Count.
Note: you must take into account the current script language - C# or VB.Net. You may check it via Report.ScriptLanguage property.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.ExtractMacros
member.summary: Used to extract macros such as "TotalPages#" in the preview mode.
member.remarks: This method is used mainly by the TextObject to extract macros and replace it with actual values passed in the pageIndex and totalPages parameters. This method is called automatically when the object is being previewed.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.IsHaveToConvert(System.Object)
member.summary: Used to get information of the need to convertation if the function returns true, then the GetConvertedObjects function is called
member.param: The export or the object, that call this method
member.remarks: The functions IsHaveToConvert and GetConvertedObjects allow you to convert objects from one to another, for example the export will convert object before adding it to the file and convert recursive, i.e. If the new object has the ability to convert, it will be converted again but limit is 10 times. At the time of export it is called, only on objects inside the band, the child objects of converted object will be returned, and the child objects of old object will be ignored.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.GetConvertedObjects
member.summary: Used to get an enumeration of the objects to which this object will be converted, before calling this function, the IsHaveToConvert function will be called
member.remarks: The functions IsHaveToConvert and GetConvertedObjects allow you to convert objects from one to another, for example the export will convert object before adding it to the file and convert recursive, i.e. If the new object has the ability to convert, it will be converted again but limit is 10 times. At the time of export it is called, only on objects inside the band, the child objects of converted object will be returned, and the child objects of old object will be ignored.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.ForEachAllConvectedObjects(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the collection of all child objects, converts objects if necessary
member.param: the object or export, that call this convertation

member.name: T:FastReport.CellularTextObject
member.summary: Represents a text object which draws each symbol of text in its own cell.
member.remarks:
The text may be aligned to left or right side, or centered. Use the property to do this. The "justify" align is not supported now, as well as vertical alignment.
The cell size is defined in the and properties. These properties are 0 by default, in this case the size of cell is calculated automatically based on the object's Font.
To define a spacing (gap) between cells, use the and properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.CellularTextObject.CellWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of cell, in pixels.
member.remarks: If zero width and/or height specified, the object will calculate the cell size automatically based on its font.

member.name: P:FastReport.CellularTextObject.CellHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of cell, in pixels.
member.remarks: If zero width and/or height specified, the object will calculate the cell size automatically based on its font.

member.name: P:FastReport.CellularTextObject.HorzSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal spacing between cells, in pixels.

member.name: P:FastReport.CellularTextObject.VertSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical spacing between cells, in pixels.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default settings.

member.name: T:FastReport.ComponentBase
member.summary: Class that implements some object's properties such as location, size and visibility.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.Draw(FastReport.Utils.FRPaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Draws the object.

remarks.para: This method is widely used in the FastReport. It is called each time when the object needs to draw or print itself.
In order to draw the object correctly, you should multiply the object's bounds by the scale parameter.

cache parameter is used to optimize the drawing speed. It holds all items such as pens, fonts, brushes, string formats that was used before. If the item with requested parameters exists in the cache, it will be returned (instead of create new item and then dispose it).

member.summary: Gets the absolute bounding rectangle of the object.

member.summary: Gets the absolute left coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.AbsRight
member.summary: Gets the absolute right coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.AbsTop
member.summary: Gets the absolute top coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the edges of the container to which a control is bound and determines how a control is resized with its parent.

remarks.para: Use the Anchor property to define how a control is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. Anchoring a control to its parent control ensures that the anchored edges remain in the same position relative to the edges of the parent control when the parent control is resized.

You can anchor a control to one or more edges of its container. For example, if you have a band with a TextObject whose Anchor property value is set to Top, Bottom, the TextObject is stretched to maintain the anchored distance to the top and bottom edges of the band as the height of the band is increased.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Bottom
member.summary: Gets the bottom coordinate of the object in relation to its container.
member.remarks: To change the bottom coordinate, change the and/or properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding rectangle of the object.
member.remarks: Assigning a value to this property is equal to assigning values to the , , , properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.ClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of client area of the object.
member.remarks: This property is used in the class.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Dock
member.summary: Gets or sets which control borders are docked to its parent control and determines how a control is resized with its parent.

remarks.para: Use the Dock property to define how a control is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. For example, setting Dock to DockStyle.Left causes the control to align itself with the left edges of its parent control and to resize as the parent control is resized.
A control can be docked to one edge of its parent container or can be docked to all edges and fill the parent container.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.GroupIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets a group index.
member.remarks: Group index is used to group objects in the designer (using "Group" button). When you select any object in a group, entire group becomes selected. To reset a group, set the GroupIndex to 0 (default value).

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase
member.summary: The base class for all data connection components such as .

member.summary: Does nothing

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.ShouldNotDispose(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)
member.summary: Does nothing

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.DataSet
member.summary: Gets an internal DataSet object that contains all data tables.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.Tables
member.summary: Gets a collection of data tables in this connection.
member.remarks: To add a table to the connection, you must either create a new TableDataSource and add it to this collection or call the method which will add all tables available in the database.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets a connection string that contains all connection parameters.

remarks.para: To modify some parameter of the connection, use respective ConnectionStringBuilder class.

Security note: the connection string may contain a user name/password. This information is stored in a report file. By default, it is crypted using the standard FastReport's password. Since FastReport's source code is available to anyone who paid for it, it may be insecure to use the standard password. For more security, you should use own password. To do this, specify it in the Crypter.DefaultPassword property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.ConnectionStringExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets an expression that returns a connection string.
member.remarks:
Use this property to set the connection string dynamically.
The recommended way to do this is to define a report parameter. You can do this in the "Data" window. Once you have defined the parameter, you can use it to pass a value to the connection. Set the ConnectionStringExpression property of the connection object to the report parameter's name (so it will look like [myReportParam]). To pass a value to the report parameter from your application, use the method.
Once you set value for this property, the property will be ignored when report is run.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.IsSqlBased
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates if this connection is SQL-based.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.LoginPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a login dialog appears immediately before opening a connection.
member.remarks:
Set LoginPrompt to true to provide login dialog when establishing a connection. If this property is false (by default), you should provide login information (user name and password) in the property. Though that property is stored in a crypted form, this may be insecure.
Another way to pass login information to the connection is to use property that is bound to the report parameter. In that case you supply the entire connection string from your application.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the command timeout, in seconds.

member.summary: Initializes a DataSet instance.
member.remarks: This method is used to support FastReport infrastructure. You don't need to use it.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.DisposeDataSet
member.summary: Disposes a DataSet.
member.remarks: This method is used to support FastReport infrastructure. You don't need to use it.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.SetConnectionString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the connection string.
member.remarks: Use this method if you need to perform some actions when the connection string is set.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetConnectionStringWithLoginInfo(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a connection string that contains username and password specified.
member.remarks: Override this method to pass login information to the connection. Typical implementation must get the existing , merge specified login information into it and return the new value.

member.summary: Fills the collection with all tables available in the database.

member.param: Set to true to initialize each table's schema.

member.summary: Gets an array of table names available in the database.

member.summary: Returns a type of connection.
member.remarks:
You should override this method if you developing a new connection component.
If your connection component does not use data connection, you need to override the and methods instead.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetConnection
member.summary: Returns a connection object.
member.remarks: Either creates a new DbConnection instance of type provided by the method, or returns the application connection if set in the Config.DesignerSettings.ApplicationConnection.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.OpenConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)
member.summary: Opens a specified connection object.
member.remarks:
Use this method to open a connection returned by the method.
This method displays a login dialog if your connection has the property set to true. Once you have entered an user name and password in this dialog, it will remeber the entered values and will not used anymore in this report session.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.DisposeConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)

member.summary: Returns a object that is specific to this connection.
member.param: The SQL command used to fetch a table data rows.
member.remarks:
You should override this method if you are developing a new connection component. In this method, you need to create the adapter and set its SelectCommand's parameters.
If your connection does not use data adapter, you need to override the and methods instead.

member.remarks: This property is used in the report designer to display available data types when you edit the connection parameters. For example, the type of OleDbConnection parameter is a OleDbType.

member.summary: Gets or sets SQL "select" command.
member.remarks: If this command contains parameters, you should specify them in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.TableDataSource.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a collection of parameters used by "select" command.
member.remarks:
You must set up this property if the SQL query that you've specified in the property contains parameters.
You can pass a value to the SQL parameter in two ways.
The right way is to define a report parameter. You can do this in the "Data" window. Once you have defined the parameter, you can use it to pass a value to the SQL parameter. To do this, set the SQL parameter's Expression property to the report parameter's name (so it will look like [myReportParam]). To pass a value to the report parameter from your application, use the method.
The other way (unrecommended) is to find a datasource object and set its parameter from a code:
TableDataSource ds = report.GetDataSource("My DataSource Name") as TableDataSource; ds.Parameters[0].Value = 10;
This way is not good because you hardcode the report object's name.

member.name: E:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Load
member.summary: Occurs when the FastReport engine loads data source with data.
member.remarks: Use this event if you want to implement load-on-demand. Event handler must load the data into the data object which this datasource is bound to (for example, the TableDataSource uses data from the DataTable object bound to the Table property).

remarks.para: You should initialize the datasource by the Init method before using this property.
Usually this property is used with the following code block:

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.Dictionary
member.summary: This class stores all report data items such as datasources, connections, relations, parameters, system variables.
member.remarks: You can access the report dictionary via Report.Dictionary property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Connections
member.summary: Gets a collection of connection objects available in a report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.DataSources
member.summary: Gets a collection of datasources available in a report.
member.remarks: Usually you don't need to use this property. It contains only datasources registered using the RegisterData method. All other datasources are contained in connection objects and may be accessed via property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Relations
member.summary: Gets a collection of relations.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a collection of parameters.
member.remarks: Another way to access parameters is to use the Report.Parameters property which is actually a shortcut to this property. You also may use the Report.GetParameter and Report.GetParameterValue methods.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.SystemVariables
member.summary: Gets a collection of system variables like Date, PageNofM etc.
member.remarks: Another way to access a system variable is to use the Report.GetVariableValue method.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Totals
member.summary: Gets a collection of totals.
member.remarks: Another way to get a total value is to use the Report.GetTotalValue method.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.CubeSources
member.summary: Gets a collection of cubesources available in a report.
member.remarks: Usually you don't need to use this property. It contains only cubesources registered using the RegisterData method.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.RegisteredItems
member.summary: Gets a list of registered items.
member.remarks: This property is for internal use only.

member.summary: This property is not relevant to this class.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.DateVariable
member.summary: Returns date and time of the report's start.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.PageVariable
member.summary: Returns current page number.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.TotalPagesVariable
member.summary: Returns total number of pages in the report. To use this variable, you need to enable the report's double pass.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.PageNVariable
member.summary: Returns a string containing the current page number in a form "Page N".

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.PageNofMVariable
member.summary: Returns a string containing the current page number and total pages in a form "Page N of M". To use this variable, you need to enable the report's double pass.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.RowVariable
member.summary: Returns data row number inside the group. This value is reset at the start of a new group.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.AbsRowVariable
member.summary: Returns absolute number of data row. This value is never reset at the start of a new group.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.PageMacroVariable
member.summary:
Returns current page number.
This variable is actually a macro. Its value is substituted when the component is viewed in the preview window. That means you cannot use it in an expression.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.TotalPagesMacroVariable
member.summary:
Returns the number of total pages in the report.
This variable is actually a macro. Its value is substituted when the component is viewed in the preview window. That means you cannot use it in an expression.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.CopyNameMacroVariable
member.summary:
Returns the name of the printed copy.
This variable is actually a macro. Its value is substituted when the component is viewed in the preview window. That means you cannot use it in an expression.

member.summary: Returns a level of hierarchy in the hierarchical report.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.HierarchyRowNoVariable
member.summary: Returns the row number like "1.2.1" in the hierarchical report.

member.name: T:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine
member.summary: Represents the report engine.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.ShowBand(FastReport.BandBase)
member.summary: Shows band at the current position.
member.remarks: After the band is shown, the current position is advanced by the band's height.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.CurX
member.summary: Gets or sets the current X offset.
member.remarks: This property specifies the X offset where the current band will be printed.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.CurY
member.summary: Gets or sets the current Y offset.
member.remarks: This property specifies the Y offset where the current band will be printed. After the band is printed, this value is incremented by the band's height.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.CurColumn
member.summary: Gets the index of currently printing column in the multi-column report.
member.remarks: This value is 0-based.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.CurPage
member.summary: Gets or sets index of current prepared page the current band will print on.
member.remarks: Note: the page with specified index must exists. This property is used to print side-by-side subreports and Table object. Usually you don't need to use it.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.PageWidth
member.summary: Gets the current page width, in pixels.
member.remarks: This property returns a paper width minus left and right margins.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.PageHeight
member.summary: Gets the current page height, in pixels.
member.remarks: This property returns a paper height minus top and bottom margins.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.UnlimitedHeight
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the page has unlimited height.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.UnlimitedWidth
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the page has unlimited width.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.UnlimitedHeightValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the current height of unlimited page.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.UnlimitedWidthValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the current width of unlimited page.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.PageFooterHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of page footer (including all its child bands), in pixels.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.ColumnFooterHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of column footer (including all its child bands), in pixels.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.FreeSpace
member.summary: Gets the free space on the current page, in pixels.
member.remarks: This property returns the page height minus footers height minus CurY value.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.PageNo
member.summary: Gets the current prepared page number.
member.remarks: This value is 1-based. The initial value (usually 1) is set in the Report.InitialPageNumber property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.TotalPages
member.summary: Gets the number of total pages in a prepared report.
member.remarks: To use this property, your report must be two-pass. Set the property to true.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.PageN
member.summary: Gets the string that represents the current page number.
member.remarks: This property returns a locale-based value, for example: "Page 1".

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.PageNofM
member.summary: Gets the string that represents the "Page N of M" number.
member.remarks: This property returns a locale-based value, for example: "Page 1 of 10".

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.RowNo
member.summary: Gets the current row number of currently printing band.
member.remarks: This value is 1-based. It resets to 1 on each new group.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.AbsRowNo
member.summary: Gets the running current row number of currently printing band.
member.remarks: This value is 1-based.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.Date
member.summary: Gets the date of report start.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.FinalPass
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the report is executing the final pass.
member.remarks: This property is true if report is one-pass, or if report is two-pass and the second pass is executing.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.FirstPass
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the report is executing the first pass.
member.remarks: This property is true if report is one-pass, or if report is two-pass and the first pass is executing.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.HierarchyLevel
member.summary: Gets a level of hierarchy when printing hierarchical bands.
member.remarks: The first level of hierarchy has 0 index.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.HierarchyRowNo
member.summary: Gets the row number like "1.2.1" when printing hierarchical bands.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.IsKeeping
member.summary: Returns true of keeping is enabled

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.KeepCurY
member.summary: Returns keeping position

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.StartKeep
member.summary: Starts the keep mechanism.
member.remarks: Use this method along with the method if you want to keep several bands together. Call StartKeep method before printing the first band you want to keep, then call the EndKeep method after printing the last band you want to keep.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.EndKeep
member.summary: Ends the keep mechanism.
member.remarks: Use this method along with the method if you want to keep several bands together. Call StartKeep method before printing the first band you want to keep, then call the EndKeep method after printing the last band you want to keep.

member.name: P:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.OutlineXml
member.summary: Gets xml containing outline nodes.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.AddOutline(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new outline element with specified text.
member.remarks: After you call this method, the element will be added to the current position in the outline. The next call to AddOutline will add new element as a child of this element. To shift the position, use the or OutlineUp methods.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.OutlineRoot
member.summary: Sets the current outline position to root.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.OutlineUp
member.summary: Shifts the current outline position one level up.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.AddBookmark(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new bookmark with specified name at current position.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.GetBookmarkPage(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a page number for the specified bookmark name.
member.returns: Page number if bookmark with such name found; 0 otherwise.
member.remarks:
Use this method to print the table of contents in your report. Normally it can be done using bookmarks.
You must set your report to double pass to use this method.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.ResetLogicalPageNumber
member.summary: Resets the logical page numbers.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.ShiftLastPage
member.summary: Called when the number of pages increased during DoublePass

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.StartNewPage
member.summary: Starts a new page.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.StartNewColumn
member.summary: Starts a new column.

member.name: M:FastReport.Engine.ReportEngine.ProcessObject(FastReport.TextObjectBase)
member.summary: Processes the specified text object which ProcessAt property is set to Custom.

member.name: T:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport
member.summary: Represents the image export filter.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the image format.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.SeparateFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to generate separate image file for each exported page.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false, the export filter will produce one big image containing all exported pages. Be careful using this property with a big report because it may produce out of memory error.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets image resolution, in dpi.
member.remarks: By default this property is set to 96 dpi. Use bigger values (300-600 dpi) if you going to print the exported images.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.ResolutionX
member.summary: Gets or sets horizontal image resolution, in dpi.
member.remarks: Separate horizontal and vertical resolution is used when exporting to TIFF. In other cases, use the property instead.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.ResolutionY
member.summary: Gets or sets vertical image resolution, in dpi.
member.remarks: Separate horizontal and vertical resolution is used when exporting to TIFF. In other cases, use the property instead.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.JpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the jpg image quality.
member.remarks: This property is used if is set to Jpeg. By default it is set to 100. Use lesser value to decrease the jpg file size.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.MultiFrameTiff
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determines whether to produce multi-frame tiff file.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.MonochromeTiff
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the Tiff export must produce monochrome image.
member.remarks: Monochrome tiff image is compressed using the compression method specified in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.MonochromeTiffCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression method for a monochrome TIFF image.
member.remarks:
This property is used only when exporting to TIFF image, and the property is set to true.
The valid values for this property are: EncoderValue.CompressionNone, EncoderValue.CompressionLZW, EncoderValue.CompressionRle, EncoderValue.CompressionCCITT3, EncoderValue.CompressionCCITT4. The default compression method is CCITT4.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.PaddingNonSeparatePages
member.summary: Sets padding in non separate pages

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:FastReport.HtmlObject
member.summary: Represents the Text object that may display one or several text lines.
member.remarks:
Specify the object's text in the Text property. Text may contain expressions and data items, for example: "Today is [Date]". When report is running, all expressions are calculated and replaced with actual values, so the text would be "Today is 01.01.2008".
The symbols used to find expressions in a text are set in the Brackets property. You also may disable expressions using the AllowExpressions property.
To format an expression value, use the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.HtmlObject.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component should draw right-to-left for RTL languages.

member.summary: Draws a text.

member.summary: Calculates the object's width.

member.name: M:FastReport.HtmlObject.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: T:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject
member.summary: Represents the matrix object that is used to print pivot table (also known as cross-tab).

member.name: E:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.ManualBuild
member.summary: Allows to fill the matrix in code.
member.remarks:
In most cases the matrix is connected to a datasource via the property. When you run a report, the matrix is filled with datasource values automatically.
Using this event, you can put additional values to the matrix or even completely fill it with own values (if is set to null. To do this, call the Data.AddValue method. See the method for more details.

member.summary: Allows to modify the prepared matrix elements such as cells, rows, columns.

member.remarks: This property can be used if matrix has two or more data cells. Default property value is false - that means the data cells will be stacked.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.KeepCellsSideBySide
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the side-by-side cells must be kept together on the same page.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a data source.
member.remarks: When you create the matrix in the designer by drag-drop data columns into it, this property will be set automatically. However you need to set it if you create the matrix in code.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.Filter

member.name: M:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.Value(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the data cell with the specified index.
member.param: Zero-based index of the data cell.
member.remarks:
Use this method in the cell's expression if the cell has custom totals (the total function is set to "Custom"). The example:
Matrix1.Value(0) / Matrix1.Value(1)
will return the result of dividing the first data cell's value by the second one.

member.name: T:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData
member.summary: Contains a set of properties and methods to hold and manipulate the matrix descriptors.
member.remarks:
This class contains three collections of descriptors such as , and . Use collections' methods to add/remove descriptors. When you are done, call the method to refresh the matrix.
To fill a matrix in code, use the AddValue method.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.Columns
member.summary: Gets a collection of column descriptors.
member.remarks: Note: after you change something in this collection, call the method to refresh the matrix.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.Rows
member.summary: Gets a collection of row descriptors.
member.remarks: Note: after you change something in this collection, call the method to refresh the matrix.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.Cells
member.summary: Gets a collection of data cell descriptors.
member.remarks: Note: after you change something in this collection, call the method to refresh the matrix.

member.name: M:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.Clear
member.summary: Clears all descriptors.

member.name: M:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.AddValue(System.Object[],System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds a value in the matrix.
member.remarks: The number of elements in an array passed to this method must be the same as a number of descriptors in the appropriate collection. That is, if your matrix has one column, two row and one cell descriptors (in Columns, Rows and Cells collections respectively), you have to pass one-element array for the columnValues param, two-element array for the rowValues and one-element array for the cellValues.

member.name: M:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.AddValue(System.Object[],System.Object[],System.Object[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a value in the matrix.
member.remarks: See the method for more details.

member.summary: Gets a value with specified column, row and cell indicies.

member.summary: Sets the cell's value.

member.name: T:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor
member.summary: The descriptor that is used to describe one element of the matrix header.
member.remarks:
The class is used to define one header element of the matrix (either the column element or row element). The key properties are , and .
To set visual appearance of the element, use the property. To set visual appearance of the "total" element, use the property.
The collection of descriptors used to represent the matrix header is stored in the MatrixObject.Data.Columns and MatrixObject.Data.Rows properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.Sort
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order of header values.
member.remarks: This property determines how the values displayed in this element are sorted. The default sort is ascending.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.Totals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that this element has associated "total" element.
member.remarks: To access the matrix cell that is bound to the "Total" element, use the property. It may be useful to change the "Total" text by something else.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.TotalsFirst
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the total values must be printed before the data.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.PageBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the page break must be printed before this element.
member.remarks: Page break is not printed before the very first element.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.SuppressTotals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether it is necessary to suppress totals if there is only one value in a group.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.TemplateTotalColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets the template column bound to the "total" element of this descriptor.
member.remarks: This property is for internal use; usually you don't need to use it.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.TemplateTotalRow
member.summary: Gets or sets the template row bound to the "total" element of this descriptor.
member.remarks: This property is for internal use; usually you don't need to use it.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.TemplateTotalCell
member.summary: Gets or sets the template cell bound to the "total" element of this descriptor.
member.remarks:
This property may be useful to change the "Total" text by something else.
Before using this property, you must initialize the matrix descriptors by calling the method.

member.name: M:FastReport.PictureObject.ForceLoadImage
member.summary: Forces loading the image from a data column.
member.remarks: Call this method in the AfterData event handler to force loading an image into the property. Normally, the image is stored internally as byte[] array and never loaded into the Image property, to save the time. The side effect is that you can't analyze the image properties such as width and height. If you need this, call this method before you access the Image property. Note that this will significantly slow down the report.

member.name: T:FastReport.Preview.PreparedPages
member.summary: Represents the pages of a prepared report.

remarks.para: Prepared page is a page that you can see in the preview window. Prepared pages can be accessed via property.

The common scenarios of using this object are:
Working with prepared pages after the report is finished: load () or save () pages from/to a .fpx file, get a page with specified index to work with its objects (); modify specified page ().
Using the , , methods while report is generating to produce an output.

remarks.para: This property is used while report is generating.

Default value for this property is true. That means the prepared pages may be uploaded to the file cache if needed. To prevent this (for example, if you need to access some objects on previously generated pages), set the property value to false.

member.name: T:FastReport.Report
member.summary: Represents a report object.
member.remarks:
The instance of this class contains a report. Here are some common actions that can be performed with this object:
To load a report, use the method or call static method.
To save a report, call the method.
To register application dataset for use it in a report, call one of the RegisterData methods.
To pass some parameter to a report, use the method.
To design a report, call the method.
To run a report and preview it, call the method. Another way is to call the method, then call the method.
To run a report and print it, call the method. Another way is to call the method, then call the method.
To load/save prepared report, use one of the LoadPrepared and SavePrepared methods.
To set up some global properties, use the static class or component that you can use in the Visual Studio IDE.
The report consists of one or several report pages (pages of the type) and/or dialog forms (pages of the type). They are stored in the collection. In turn, each page may contain report objects. See the example below how to create a simple report in code.

member.name: M:FastReport.Report.ShowPaswordForm(System.String)
member.summary: Does nothing

member.name: E:FastReport.Report.CustomCalc
member.summary: Occurs when calc execution is started.

member.name: E:FastReport.Report.LoadBaseReport
member.summary: Occurs when report is inherited and trying to load a base report.
member.remarks: Typical use of this event is to load the base report from a database instead of a file.

member.name: E:FastReport.Report.StartReport
member.summary: Occurs when report execution is started.

member.name: E:FastReport.Report.FinishReport
member.summary: Occurs when report execution is finished.

member.name: E:FastReport.Report.ExportParameters
member.summary: Occurs before export to set custom export parameters.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.Pages
member.summary: Gets the pages contained in this report.
member.remarks: This property contains pages of all types (report and dialog). Use the is/as operators if you want to work with pages of ReportPage type.
member.example:
The following code demonstrates how to access the first report page:
ReportPage page1 = report1.Pages[0] as ReportPage;

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.Dictionary
member.summary: Gets the report's data.
member.remarks: The dictionary contains all data items such as connections, data sources, parameters, system variables.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the collection of report parameters.

remarks.para: Parameters are displayed in the "Data" window under the "Parameters" node.
Typical use of parameters is to pass some static data from the application to the report. You can print such data, use it in the data row filter, script etc.

Another way to use parameters is to define some reusable piece of code, for example, to define an expression that will return the concatenation of first and second employee name. In this case, you set the parameter's Expression property to something like this: [Employees.FirstName] + " " + [Employees.LastName]. Now this parameter may be used in the report to print full employee name. Each time you access such parameter, it will calculate the expression and return its value.
You can create nested parameters. To do this, add the new Parameter to the Parameters collection of the root parameter. To access the nested parameter, you may use the method.
To get or set the parameter's value, use the and methods. To set the parameter's expression, use the method that returns a Parameter object and set its Expression property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.ReportInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the report information such as report name, author, description etc.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.BaseReport
member.summary: Gets or sets the base report file name.
member.remarks: This property contains the name of a report file this report is inherited from. Note: setting this property to non-empty value will clear the report and load the base file into it.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.BaseReportAbsolutePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute path to the parent report.
member.remarks: This property contains the absolute path to the parent report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a file the report was loaded from.
member.remarks: This property is used to support the FastReport.Net infrastructure; typically you don't need to use it.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.ScriptText
member.summary: Gets or sets the report script.

remarks.para: The script contains the ReportScript class that contains all report objects' event handlers and own items such as private fields, properties, methods etc. The script contains only items written by you. Unlike other report generators, the script does not contain report objects declarations, initialization code. It is added automatically when you run the report.
By default this property contains an empty script text. You may see it in the designer when you switch to the Code window.

If you set this property programmatically, you have to declare the FastReport namespace and the ReportScript class in it. Do not declare report items (such as bands, objects, etc) in the ReportScript class: the report engine does this automatically when you run the report.

Security note: since the report script is compiled into .NET assembly, it allows you to do ANYTHING. For example, you may create a script that will read/write files from/to a disk. To restrict such operations, use the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.ScriptLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the script language of this report.
member.remarks: Note: changing this property will reset the report script to default empty script.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.ConvertNulls
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the null DB value must be converted to zero, false or empty string depending on the data column type.
member.remarks: This property is true by default. If you set it to false, you should check the DB value before you do something with it (for example, typecast it to any type, use it in a expression etc.)

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.DoublePass
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the report engine should perform the second pass.

remarks.para: Typically the second pass is necessary to print the number of total pages. It also may be used to perform some calculations on the first pass and print its results on the second pass.
Use the Engine.FirstPass, Engine.FinalPass properties to determine which pass the engine is performing now.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.Compressed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to compress the report file.
member.remarks: The report file is compressed using the Gzip algorithm. So you can open the compressed report in any zip-compatible archiver.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.UseFileCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to use the file cache rather than memory to store the prepared report pages.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.TextQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the quality of text rendering.
member.remarks: Note: the default property value is TextQuality.Default. That means the report may look different depending on OS settings. This property does not affect the printout.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.SmoothGraphics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if the graphic objects such as bitmaps and shapes should be displayed smoothly.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the report password.

remarks.para: When you try to load the password-protected report, you will be asked for a password. You also may specify the password in this property before loading the report. In this case the report will load silently.
Password-protected report file is crypted using Rijndael algorithm. Do not forget your password! It will be hard or even impossible to open the protected file in this case.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.AutoFillDataSet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether it is necessary to automatically fill DataSet registered with RegisterData call.
member.remarks: If this property is true (by default), FastReport will automatically fill the DataSet with data when you trying to run a report. Set it to false if you want to fill the DataSet by yourself.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.MaxPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of generated pages in a prepared report.
member.remarks: Use this property to limit the number of pages in a prepared report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.Styles
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of styles used in this report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Report.ReferencedAssemblies
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of assembly names that will be used to compile the report script.
member.remarks: By default this property contains the following assemblies: "System.dll", "System.Drawing.dll", "System.Windows.Forms.dll", "System.Data.dll", "System.Xml.dll". If your script uses some types from another assemblies, you have to add them to this property.

remarks.para: The expression may be any valid expression such as "1 + 2". The expression is calculated in the report script's ReportScript class instance context, so you may refer to any objects available in this context: private fields, methods, report objects.

member.remarks: Use this method if you register more than one dataset. You may specify any value for the name parameter: it is not displayed anywhere in the designer and used only to load/save a report. The name must be persistent and unique for each registered dataset.

member.name: M:FastReport.Report.RegisterData(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers the application dataset with specified name and enables all its tables.
member.param: The boolean value indicating whether all tables should be enabled.
member.remarks: Use this method if you register more than one dataset. You may specify any value for the name parameter: it is not displayed anywhere in the designer and used only to load/save a report. The name must be persistent and unique for each registered dataset.

member.name: M:FastReport.Report.RegisterData(System.Data.DataTable,System.String)

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets an object's fill.
member.remarks:
The fill can be one of the following types: , , , .
To set the solid fill color, use the simpler property.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color in a simple manner.
member.remarks: This property can be used in a report script to change the fill color of the object. It is equivalent to: reportComponent1.Fill = new SolidFill(color);

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.Bookmark
member.summary: Gets or sets a bookmark expression.
member.remarks: This property can contain any valid expression that returns a bookmark name. This can be, for example, a data column. To navigate to a bookmark, you have to use the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.Hyperlink
member.summary: Gets or sets a hyperlink.

remarks.para: The hyperlink is used to define clickable objects in the preview. When you click such object, you may navigate to the external url, the page number, the bookmark defined by other report object, or display the external report. Set the Kind property of the hyperlink to select appropriate behavior.

Usually you should set the Expression property of the hyperlink to any valid expression that will be calculated when this object is about to print. The value of an expression will be used for navigation.
If you want to navigate to something fixed (URL or page number, for example) you also may set the Value property instead of Expression.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.CanGrow
member.summary: Determines if the object can grow.
member.remarks: This property is applicable to the bands or text objects that can contain several text lines. If the property is set to true, object will grow to display all the information that it contains.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.CanShrink
member.summary: Determines if the object can shrink.
member.remarks: This property is applicable to the bands or text objects that can contain several text lines. If the property is set to true, object can shrink to remove the unused space.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.GrowToBottom
member.summary: Determines if the object must grow to the band's bottom side.
member.remarks: If the property is set to true, object grows to the bottom side of its parent. This is useful if you have several objects on a band, and some of them can grow or shrink.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.ShiftMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a shift mode of the object.
member.remarks: See enumeration for details.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style name.
member.remarks: Style is a set of common properties such as border, fill, font, text color. The Report has a set of styles in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.EvenStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a style name that will be applied to even band rows.
member.remarks: Style with this name must exist in the collection.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.HoverStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a style name that will be applied to this object when the mouse pointer is over it.
member.remarks: Style with this name must exist in the collection.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.EvenStylePriority
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines which properties of the even style to use.
member.remarks: Usually you will need only the Fill property of the even style to be applied. If you want to apply all style settings, set this property to StylePriority.UseAll.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.PrintOn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines where to print the object.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for details.

member.summary: Gets or sets a script event name that will be fired before the object will be printed in the preview page.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.AfterPrintEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script event name that will be fired after the object was printed in the preview page.

member.remarks: This flag is used to disable some toolbar buttons when such object is selected. Applicable to the ShapeObject and LineObject.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.FlagUseBorder
member.summary: Determines if the object uses the Border.
member.remarks: This flag is used to disable some toolbar buttons when such object is selected.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.FlagUseFill

member.summary: Determines if serializing the Style property is needed.
member.remarks: The Style property must be serialized last. Some ancestor classes may turn off the standard Style serialization and serialize it by themselves.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.FlagProvidesHyperlinkValue
member.summary: Determines if an object can provide the hyperlink value automatically.
member.remarks: This flag is used in complex objects such as Matrix or Chart. These objects can provide a hyperlink value automatically, depending on where you click.

member.name: M:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Initializes the object before running a report.
member.remarks: This method is used by the report engine, do not call it directly.

member.name: M:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.FinalizeComponent
member.summary: Performs a finalization after the report is finished.
member.remarks: This method is used by the report engine, do not call it directly.

member.name: M:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.SaveState
member.summary: Saves the object's state before printing it.
member.remarks:
This method is called by the report engine before processing the object.
Do not call it directly. You may override it if you are developing a new FastReport component. In this method you should save any object properties that may be changed during the object printing. The standard implementation saves the object's bounds, visibility, bookmark and hyperlink.

member.name: M:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.RestoreState
member.summary: Restores the object's state after printing it.
member.remarks:
This method is called by the report engine after processing the object.
Do not call it directly. You may override it if you are developing a new FastReport component. In this method you should restore the object properties that were saved by the method.

member.name: M:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.CalcHeight
member.summary: Calculates the object's height.
member.remarks: Applicable to objects that contain several text lines, such as TextObject. Returns the height needed to display all the text lines.

member.name: M:FastReport.ReportComponentBase.GetData
member.summary: Gets the data from a datasource that the object is connected to.
member.remarks:
This method is called by the report engine before processing the object.
Do not call it directly. You may override it if you are developing a new FastReport component. In this method you should get the data from a datasource that the object is connected to.

member.name: T:FastReport.ReportPage
member.summary: Represents a report page.
member.remarks:
To get/set a paper size and orientation, use the , and properties. Note that paper size is measured in millimeters.
Report page can contain one or several bands with report objects. Use the , , , , , , properties to get/set the page bands. The property holds the list of data bands or groups. Thus you may add several databands to this property to create master-master reports, for example.
Report page can contain bands only. You cannot place report objects such as TextObject on a page.

member.name: E:FastReport.ReportPage.StartPage
member.summary: This event occurs when the report engine starts this page.

member.name: E:FastReport.ReportPage.FinishPage
member.summary: This event occurs when the report engine finished this page.

member.name: E:FastReport.ReportPage.ManualBuild
member.summary: This event occurs when the report engine is about to print databands in this page.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportPage.PaperWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a width of the paper, in millimeters.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportPage.ExportAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets the page name on export

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportPage.PaperHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a height of the paper, in millimeters.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportPage.RawPaperSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw index of a paper size.
member.remarks:
This property stores the RawKind value of a selected papersize. It is used to distiguish between several papers with the same size (for ex. "A3" and "A3 with no margins") used in some printer drivers.
It is not obligatory to set this property. FastReport will select the necessary paper using the PaperWidth and PaperHeight values.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the page has unlimited height.

member.remarks: This property may be useful if you work with such objects as Matrix and Table.

member.name: P:FastReport.ReportPage.StartOnOddPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this page will start on an odd page only.
member.remarks: This property is useful to print booklet-type reports. Setting this property to true means that this page will start to print on an odd page only. If necessary, an empty page will be added to the prepared report before this page will be printed.

member.name: T:FastReport.Table.TableObject
member.summary: Represents a table object that consists of several rows and columns.
member.remarks:
To add/remove columns, use the collection. To add/remove rows, use the collection. To initialize a table with specified number of columns and rows, use and properties.
To print a table in code, use the event. In the manual build mode, you can use aggregate functions. The following functions available:
Aggregate function Description
Sum(cell) Calculates the sum of values in specified table cell.
Min(cell) Calculates the minimum of values in specified table cell.
Max(cell) Calculates the maximum of values in specified table cell.
Avg(cell) Calculates the average of values in specified table cell.
Count(cell) Calculates the number of repeats of a specified table cell.
To print aggregate value, place the aggregate function call in the table cell: [Count(Cell2)].

member.name: E:FastReport.Table.TableObject.ManualBuild
member.summary: Allows to print table rows/columns dynamically.
member.remarks:
This event is used to handle the table print process in a code. Using special methods like , you can print specified rows/columns.
First way is to repeat specified row(s) to get a table that will grow downwards. To do this, you have to call the PrintRow method followed by the PrintColumns method.
Another way is to repeat the specified column(s) to get a table that grows sidewards. To do this, call the PrintColumn method followed by the PrintRows method.
Finally, the third way is to repeat rows and columns. The table will grow downwards and sidewards. To do this, call the PrintRow method followed by the PrintColumn method (or vice versa).
When you print a table row-by-row, you must call one of the PrintColumn, PrintColumns methods right after the PrintRow method. In the same manner, when you print a table column-by-column, call one of the PrintRow, PrintRows methods right after the PrintColumn method. If you ignore this rule you will get an exception.

member.name: P:FastReport.Table.TableObject.ManualBuildEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script method name that will be used to handle the event.
member.remarks: If you use this event, you must handle the table print process manually. See the event for details.

member.name: T:FastReport.TextObject
member.summary: Represents the Text object that may display one or several text lines.
member.remarks:
Specify the object's text in the Text property. Text may contain expressions and data items, for example: "Today is [Date]". When report is running, all expressions are calculated and replaced with actual values, so the text would be "Today is 01.01.2008".
The symbols used to find expressions in a text are set in the Brackets property. You also may disable expressions using the AllowExpressions property.
To format an expression value, use the property.

member.remarks: To limit the minimum size, use the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.TextObject.AutoShrinkMinSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of font (or minimum width ratio) if the mode is on.
member.remarks:
This property determines the minimum font size (in case the property is set to FontSize), or the minimum font width ratio (if AutoShrink is set to FontWidth).
The default value is 0, that means no limits.

member.name: T:FastReport.Utils.AssemblyInitializerBase
member.summary: Base class for plugin's assembly initializer.
member.remarks:
FastReport has an open architecture. That means you can extend it with own classes such as report objects, wizards, export filters. Usually such classes are placed in separate dlls (plugins). FastReport has mechanism to load plugin dlls. You can specify which plugins to load at first start, in the FastReport configuration file (by default it is located in the C:\Documents and Settings\User_Name\Local Settings\Application Data\FastReport\FastReport.config file). To do this, add an xml item with your plugin name inside the <Plugins> item:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Config> <Plugins> <Plugin Name="c:\Program Files\MyProgram\MyPlugin.dll"/> </Plugins> </Config>
When you run your application and use the Report object first time, all plugins will be loaded. To register objects contained in a plugin, FastReport searches for classes of type AssemblyInitializerBase and instantiates them.
Use this class to register custom report objects, controls, wizards, exports that are contained in the assembly. To do this, make your own class of the AssemblyInitializerBase type and override its default constructor. In the constructor, call RegisteredObjects.Add methods to register all necessary items.

member.name: M:FastReport.Utils.AssemblyInitializerBase.#ctor
member.summary: Registers plugins contained in this assembly.
member.remarks: This constructor is called automatically when the assembly is loaded.
